name: YellowPepper
overview:
YellowPepper is the leading mobile financial network in Latin America.

It allows banks, Mobile Network Operators (MNOs), merchants, and consumers to conduct mobile financial transactions in a secure, efficient and convenient manner. The company currently operates in 9 countries: Mexico, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, Guatemala, Dominican Republic, Bolivia, Haiti, and Panama; it has over 4.8 million monthly active users for m-banking services and handles over 20 million financial and informational transactions per month.

YellowPepper’s key strength is the network’s ability to allow any participating bank, MNO, fast moving consumer goods (FMCG) or individuals to interconnect in a fast, efficient and reliable manner. Serge Elkiner, a pioneer in the mobile banking payments solutions space is the co-founder of YellowPepper. The company currently employs 203 employees in 10 countries.

YellowPepper’s shareholders include a value added mix of early angel investors, a Latin American strategic group and the IFC/World Bank.

The Company’s products and solutions include: traditional mobile banking (m-banking) services to reach individuals with bank accounts, mobile wallets (m-wallets) to reach individuals without bank accounts, as well as an innovative B2B mobile payments network. More than 40 banks and companies in Latin America and the Caribbean, including Western Union, Coca-Cola and Credibanco VISA, have selected YellowPepper as their strategic partner. Over 17 companies in 5 countries (Peru, the Dominican Republic, Colombia, Mexico and Ecuador) use YellowPepper’s B2B mobile financial solutions to transact with small business in their supply or distribution chain, benefitting more than 700 small businesses. Currently, over 500,000 customers in Haiti are using their TchoTcho mobile wallets promoted by Digicel in association with YellowPepper and Scotia Bank.

YellowPepper is fulfilling a market need for a neutral, universal network that enables financial institutions, MNOs, wholesalers, retailers, consumer, and others to conduct financial transactions using mobile phones. By doing so YellowPepper is laying the foundation for a robust financial network in which businesses, governments and consumers can transact with each other more easily, efficiently and affordably.

A 78% mobile phone penetration rate coupled with an abysmal 35% financial access rate in Latin America and the Caribbean present a significant business opportunity.
